<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 585]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 724, 600]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity is needed, use \(10 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 593, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 615, 606, 630]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 644, 608, 659]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 756, 675]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 675, 440, 690]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
A man pushes a wheelbarrow of mass \(25\mathrm{kg}\) along a horizontal road with a constant force of magnitude \(35\mathrm{N}\) at an angle of \(20^{\circ}\) below the horizontal. There is a constant resistance to motion of \(15\mathrm{N}\). The wheelbarrow moves a distance of \(12\mathrm{m}\) from rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 135, 156, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 135, 415, 153]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
A train travels between two stations, \(A\) and \(B\). The train starts from rest at \(A\) and accelerates at a constant rate for \(T\) s until it reaches a speed of \(25 \mathrm{m s}^{-1}\) . It then travels at this constant speed before decelerating at a constant rate, coming to rest at \(B\). The magnitude of the train's deceleration is twice the magnitude of its acceleration. The total time taken for the journey is \(180 \mathrm{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 149, 156, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 149, 683, 168]]<|/det|>
Sketch the velocity-time graph for the train's journey from \(A\) to \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[324, 171, 747, 345]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 359, 156, 377]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 357, 920, 392]]<|/det|>
Find an expression, in terms of \(T\), for the length of time for which the train is travelling with constant speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 373, 920, 392]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 580, 153, 598]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 580, 920, 598]]<|/det|>
The distance from \(A\) to \(B\) is \(3300 \text{m}\). Find how far the train travels while it is decelerating.

<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
A particle is projected vertically upwards from a point \(O\) with a speed of \(12 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\). Two seconds later a second particle is projected vertically upwards from \(O\) with a speed of \(20 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\). At time \(t\) s after the second particle is projected, the two particles collide.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 138, 156, 155]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 138, 215, 155]]<|/det|>
Find \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 138, 920, 155]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that the resistance to motion of the car is \((590 + 2v) \text{N}\) when the speed of the car is \(\nu \text{m s}^{-1}\) . The car travels at a constant speed with the engine working at \(16 \text{kW}\). Find this speed. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(m = 3\), the system is released from rest with the string taut. Find the total distance travelled by \(A\) before coming to instantaneous rest. You may assume that \(A\) does not reach the pulley.
